data.title: Don't go if you are in a hurry
data.text: This is the kind of place you want to go for good Italian food just sit and linger over a bottle of wine and chat with good friends. Don't rush relax or go early enough to get to your next venue. We got there at 6:00 and had a concert to be at at 8:00 . We got out with time to walk to the Deyor theater. But we did have to push our waiter along a little he was a little slow. Service was ok . I had the Papadella with pink sauce and a meatball it was great they make there own pasta and the meatball was huge . Took half home . My husband had the chicken parm and he really liked it and he also had leftovers . We started out with calamari it had an Asian flavor that would have been fine but not for an Italian restaurant . I can't wait to go back  and have the time to not have to rush the place is so charming . You feel so at home there. You will not be disappointed. You can share a plate but they charge 5.00 but it would be worth it they give generous portions.

data.title: Italian Eatery
data.text: Pretty good Italian food. "Scarole" with hot pepper was very good. Lasagna with meatball was very flavorful. Wine list fair. Good service.

data.title: Revisit downtown Youngstown
data.text: A great restaurant in the heart of Youngstown. Wonderful service good food convenient location. Portion size is out of control. Focus on quality vs quantity. A great alternative to the standard fare. Recommend this stop to all locals

data.title: True Italian! What a Find!!
data.text:
Returning to Columbus through northeastern Ohio with friends, we found Roberto's on TripAdvisor. Wow!!

Roberto's is a family operated, intimately sized Italian restaurant in downtown Youngstown, serving reasonably priced real Italian food. Easily accessed from I-80.

The portions are large and ingredients are fresh and delicious! The pasta was fresh as were the sauces. It was nice to be in an Italian restaurant that uses garlic as a compliment to taste rather than relying on it. We had the hot peppers in oil (fresh and hot!), calamari in a sweet sauce with pepper flakes (a little sweet, but very good) and the sliced brussel sprouts (seared in oil with ham bit.....fab!)
Entrees were melt in your mouth lasagna, ravioli, eggplant Parmigiana, and veal. There were just too many compliments to list here!
 We agreed that probably should have stopped at the appetizers after seeing the portion size, but hey, you can take it home, right? Which we did..... along with some canoli's!!

Come to Roberto's hungry, you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Unforgettable Fiocchi
data.text: These little "pasta purses" we're not part of my upbringing in an Italian family or among my own cooking explorations. What a treat ... and surprise...to discover ... in  downtown Youngstown, Ohio  ...Roberto's extraordinary Fiocchi with pear and four cheese filling in a chicken butter broth. Delicate, flavorful, unforgettable. Our table also loved the shaved Brussel Sprouts, warm homemade bread with cheesy dipping oil, and Roberto's Paris dressing on our house salads. The house also makes a nice tomato sauce with tasty, tender meatballs which they serve on their more commonly-found and delicious dishes like gnocchi, eggplant or chicken Parmesan. But, go for the Fiocchi and the experience of dining in a place where everyone is glad you came and thrilled that you loved what you ate. You'll go home with leftovers from their substantial portions and wondering how soon you can get back there again. Another find: a lovely Italian red blend wine called If You See Kay. Ask your server for the backstory.

data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text:
Roberto's has a pink vodka sauce I dream about. Couple that with the shaved brussel sprouts and I was a very happy birthday girl. 
I've been here a few times, and I'm never disappointed. Excellent food and excellent service are always found at Roberto's. Definitely a must if you're in Youngstown.

data.title: MMMMMMM
data.text: Great place! Great find!  This place reminds me of a great Italian restaurant in NYC not Youngstown, OH.  We love it!

data.title: Best Italian food in Yo.
data.text: Roberto's is a small elegant restaurant with a staff that offers great service and the best Italian food in the city.

data.title: Fantastic Experience at Roberto's!!
data.text: We eat here every week!! It is a slice of Italian Heaven in downtown Youngstown!!! It is like walking into Tavern on the Green,..but, the food here is BETTER!! Great service..Beautiful atmosphere... Fantastico'!!

data.title: Customer
data.text:
Always my favorite place to visit downtown Youngstown. Feel like I'm in Italy every time. Staff is awesome. 
Love these people and this place.

data.title: Ambiance
data.text: This is a quiet retreat in downtown Youngstown.  With a few tables outside, a nice bar area in the front window, and a long narrow room it reminds you of the restaurants in Little Italy in New York.   The staff is very friendly and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome.  The food is good with a tasty tomato sauce for the pasta entrees.  Try the lemoncello dessert for a special treat!

data.title: One of the best ever!!!!
data.text: I went to Roberto's for the first time 4 months ago and I was amazed by everything about it.. The food was the best I had ever had. Homemade pasta, dipping oil with homemade bread that was served warm, and other amazing foods on the menu. The atmosphere reminded me of an NYC restaurant only more personal. The owners greeted us at the door with warm smiles as they welcomed us to the restaurant. The servers were friendly and very helpful answering questions about different dishes on the menu. It was an all around amazing experience and because of our first visit being so wonderful, we have continued to go back at least once a week. This is a restaurant that everyone should try. It is a totally amazing place for dining and an all around enjoyable time..

data.title: Everything is wonderful every time you go!!!
data.text: Roberto's is absolutely off the charts in every aspect, and it's nothing like your typical Italian restaurant, either. The staff puts so much effort into making sure the food and the atmosphere are everything you want to experience and it is!!! I've gone there on multiple occasions with my family, and tasted almost everything on the menu at this point and there is not one average meal on it... everything is spectacular!!!! Their food truly outshines every other Italian restaurant in the area because of its authentic taste and style. As for the atmosphere, the staff members are unlike any other. They are always so welcoming and you can tell they genuinely care about your experience. I love everything about it there, it's a must when in Youngstown ❤️

data.title: Best Italian food in Youngstown!!!!!
data.text: There's a lot of good Italian restaurants in Youngstown, but only one gives you a real variety of dish's. They have these little pasta pockets filled with cheese and Pear, and served in chicken broth. They our to die for. All there food is good.

data.title: Awesome time
data.text: One of my friends suggested going there and I had been there one in March...what a wonderful time. When you want the best....food,atmosphere,fun, waiters, good time, even showers. They have different size rooms that you will definitely fit your needs. Roberto's is the best place to go for any special occasion.

data.title: Great for rehearsal dinner
data.text: Had a great experience here for my rehearsal dinner the night before our wedding. Very nice and professional staff. They even helped us plan much in advance and were very accommodating for what we wanted and also our family and friends. The dinner was great. We had calamari and fried cheese for appetizers. Then, for dinner we had the options of homemade spaghetti, raviolis, gnocchi, and chicken parmesan. Everything was wonderful and our family is still raving over how great the food was.

data.title: Great food, even with take out!
data.text: I got take out from here as the wife was out with friends. With take out, I was only expecting okay food because let's face it, it's take out. I got it the 15 minutes home and the lasagna was amazing. It even came with like 6 pieces of bread/oil and a salad. I'll definitely be back with the wife next time!!

data.title: Amazing experience and food!
data.text: Had the best dinner we've had in a long time! From the friendly staff who greeted us, our very attentive server, and of course the amazing food!!! Everything was beyond our expectations! I would highly recommend Roberts to anyone!

data.title: Throw back to another time
data.text:
First the good: very nice waiter and attentive service and we had a nice table. 
Now the so so( not really bad - just reminds me of "Italian" restaurants from the 1970s) :
The main part of the restaurant seems very dark. The pasta (ravioli with 4 cheeses) and the spaghetti which came with the veal were not good, covered with tons of red sauce. The inside of my ravioli was actually cold. The small Cesar salad was drenched in dressing and not very appetizing looking although it tasted ok. The tomato bisque was very good. The veal with peppers was good. The plating, the heavy red sauce, loudish Dean Martin type music (which I liked - it was just too loud) , the darkness, all just reminded me so much of 1970s Italian restaurants. But the people are so so nice.

data.title: Party of 10
data.text: My family made a last minute reservation for 10 for my nieces graduation a couple sundays ago and it was great. I ordered the Tortelloni with sausage sauce it was clearly a homemade dish as did my brother who owns 3 restaurants in the area so we are accustomed to home made food and will not step foot in a chain to dine. He enjoyed his food as well. Thanks also for the great service I wish I could remember the gentlemans name very professional job! I will be back!
